title: Stock investors have overreacted to the Saudi oil attack
text:
Oil’s price surge might actually keep both the economy and the bull market running strong, writes Mark Hulbert. See full story.

Nervous about stocks? Bill Gates isn’t

Bill Gates told Bloomberg News that most of his assets are still invested in stocks. See full story.

Here’s the ‘panic level’ for oil

Immediate post-Saudi jump looks to be no cause for alarm. See full story.

Powell’s checklist spells out three risks the Fed must manage

. Watch the three major risks to the economy to determine what Fed policy will be, writes Caroline Baum. See full story.

Why the ECB’s calls for fiscal stimulus are playing on deaf ears

Some countries can’t spend more, the others don’t want to. And reforms to bridge the differences have stalled. See full story.

The worst paid profession improves the quality of life of millions of Americans and their elderly family members. See full story.
description: Oil’s price surge might actually keep both the economy and the bull market running strong, writes Mark Hulbert.
